import Colors

color = Colors.textMod()


# y = mx+b


[docs]def encode(user_input, m, b):
    encoded_input = []
    user_input = user_input.upper()
    for i in range(len(user_input)):
        current_char = user_input[i]
        if 65 <= ord(current_char) <= 90:
            encoded_input.append((((ord(current_char) - 65) * m) + b) % 26)
            pretty_print(ord(current_char), ((((ord(current_char) - 65) * m) + b) % 26) + 65)
        else:
            encoded_input.append(ord(current_char))  ##any other ascii values

    return encoded_input  # list of alphabet values except for spaces etc



# A*x +m

[docs]def decode(encoded, inverse, b):
    # unencoded = inverse *(encoded -m)yt
    decoded = []
    for x in encoded:
        if 0 <= x <= 26:
            zz = ((((inverse * (x - b)) % 26) + 65))
            decoded.append(chr((((inverse * (x - b)) % 26) + 65)))
            pretty_print(x + 65, zz)
        else:
            decoded.append(chr(x))

    return decoded  # list of ascii values




[docs]def print_cipher(cipher_text):
    pretty_char = []
    for i in cipher_text:
        if 0 <= i <= 25:
            i += 65
            pretty_char.append(chr(i))
        else:
            pretty_char.append(chr(i))
    print(''.join(pretty_char))




[docs]def pretty_print(before, apres):
    line = ""
    for c in range(26):
        if (65 + c) == before:
            line = line + color.blue + chr(65 + ((c) % 26)) + color.end
        elif (65 + c) == apres:
            line = line + color.green + chr(65 + ((c) % 26)) + color.end
        else:
            line = line + (chr(65 + ((c) % 26)))
    print(line)



# https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4798654/modular-multiplicative-inverse-function-in-python
# the link to the source for the egcd and modinv function.I got lazy


[docs]def egcd(a, b):
    if a == 0:
        return b, 0, 1
    else:
        g, y, x = egcd(b % a, a)
        return g, x - (b // a) * y, y




[docs]def modinv(a, m):
    g, x, y = egcd(a, m)
    if g != 1:
        return None
    else:
        return x % m



# this is mine

[docs]def checkCoPrime(proposed_value, modolus):
    possible_value = modinv(proposed_value, modolus)
    if possible_value is None:
        coPrimeList = []
        for x in range(modolus):
            res = modinv(x, modolus)
            if res is not None:
                coPrimeList.append(res)
        coPrimeList.sort()
        return coPrimeList, False
    else:
        return possible_value, True
